roleset.name: begin
roleset.note: START-V NOTES: Roleset corresponds to VN class begin-55.1-1 (from start.01-v)
START-N NOTES: Roleset based on start.01. VN class begin 55.1. Framed by Katie. (from start.01-n)

example.name: start-v: basic transitive
example.text: John started a book

example.name: start-v: transitive-with
example.text: John started the book with a murder

example.name: start-v: transitive-by
example.text: John started the book by describing a murder

example.name: start-v: instrumental object
example.text: The book started with a murder

example.name: start-v: instrumental subject
example.text: A murder started the book

example.name: start-v: with manner
example.text: John started the book with glee

example.name: start-v: with manner again
example.text: John started the book gladly

example.name: start-v: with temporal
example.text: John started the book last night

example.name: start-v: intransitive/inchoative
example.text: A storm started

example.name: start-v: aspectual, no agent
example.text: John started to sweat

example.name: start-v: a little clearer
example.text: The storm started to cause great destruction

example.name: start-v: aspectual, with agent
example.text: John started to eat the entire cake, then thought better of it.

example.name: start-v: Medical-ish example
example.text: Mary started a regimen of antibiotics.

example.name: start-n: Arg 1 is often in a PP headed by 'of'
example.text: the start of a less ambitious game

example.name: start-n: When loc may look like arg 1
example.text: his start in the movie business

example.name: start-n: example with arg 1 and tmp
example.text: The possible start of US troop withdrawals next year

example.name: start-n: Arg 0 and loc
example.text: Solace got their start in the United States.

example.name: start-n: Just because there is a 'value' does not mean the frame should automatically be start.02
example.text: lonely start in life

example.name: starting-n: Arg0, 1
example.text: He was entertained to a banquet at the Reform Club to celebrate his starting of the London Review in 1860.

roleset.name: begin traveling toward
roleset.note: START-V NOTES: Roleset added by Julia based on Brown corpus. Comparison to 'travel'. (from start.06-v)

example.name: start-v: Classic example
example.text: Mary started toward the door

roleset.name: to put someone on particular medicine or diet
roleset.note: START-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in medical Q& A corpus. Framed by Claire. No relevant VerbNet entry. (from start.101-v)

example.name: start-v: All arguments
example.text: Dr. Mary started the patient on antibiotics.

example.name: start-v: with diet as arg2
example.text: Any age is fine as long as you have started them on solids.

roleset.name: be startled, reaction to surprise
roleset.note: START-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on call home. (from start.03-v)
START-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on nouns-00060. No corresponding VNcls. (from start.03-n)

example.name: start-v: both args
example.text: She started at the sound of the refrigerator kicking on in the next room.
example.arg: at the sound of the refrigerator kicking on in the next room

example.name: start-n: corpus example, no args
example.text: By day she dragged herself to work like a zombie , but in the middle of the night she would wake with a start , her heart pounding so hard she could n't breathe .

roleset.name: housing starts/attribute
roleset.note: START-N NOTES: No corresponding VN class. Framed by Katie. (from start.02-n)

example.name: start-n: Example with args 1 and 3
example.text: Private housing starts in Japan were unchanged in September froma year earlier at 144,610 units

example.name: start-n: Example with arg 1 and 2
example.text: weaker housing starts

example.name: start-n: Tmp and arg 1
example.text: November housing starts

roleset.name: phrasal aspectual
roleset.note: START_OFF-V NOTES: Member of VN class begin-55.1-1...one of the few verb particle constructions in VN! (from start.02-v)

example.name: start_off-v: bellringing!
example.text: Proper English bells are started off in "rounds," from the highest-pitched bell to the lowest.
example.arg: [Proper English bells][in "rounds," from the highest-pitched bell to the lowest.]

example.name: start_off-v: Args 0 & 1
example.text: Typical , Nickelodeon or Disney starts them off .

example.name: start_up-v
example.text: When-1 Southwest Airlines started up at Lambert *-1, it was with one gate and a scattering of destinations.

role.descr: secondary predication (can be used on arg0 or arg1)

example.name: start_out-v: Intransitive
example.text: Loretta started out as a volunteer.

example.name: start_out-v: Transitive
example.text: Loretta started Mordecai out as a cadet.

roleset.name: begin to harangue
roleset.note: START_IN-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on Call Home. No VNcls. (from start.07-v)

example.name: start_in-v: all args
example.text: My dad started in on me about not having a job.

roleset.name: start_over: once more, from the top
roleset.note: START_OVER-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from start.08-v)

example.name: start_over-v: args 0 and 2, + ADV
example.text: And you-1 will have *PRO*-1 to start over from square 1 with the VA .

example.name: start_over-v: all args
example.text: When I turned everything back on, it would not start at the point it was stopped, it merely started the movie over from the beginning.
